-webkit-text-stroke-width:\n          0px; background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255); display: inline\n          !important; float: none;\"></span>I am a member of the groups\n        in <a href=\"http://theory.cs.princeton.edu/\">Theoretical\n          Computer Science</a> and <a href=\"http://mltheory.cs.princeton.edu/\">Theoretical Machine\n          Learning</a>. In the past I have worked on: Computational\n        Complexity (see <a href=\"http://www.cs.princeton.edu/theory/complexity/\">my book\n          on this topic</a>), <a href=\"http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Probabilistically_checkable_proof\">Probabilistically\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n          Checkable Proofs (PCPs)</a>, computing approximate solutions\n        to NP-hard problems, and related issues. For several years now I\n        am most interested in developing new theory for Machine Learning\n        (including deep learning). <a href=\"http://unsupervised.cs.princeton.edu/\">See my group\n          website</a> and also <a href=\"http://www.offconvex.org\"> the\n          blog offconvex.org</a> that I contribute to. <br>\n        <br>\n        <b>News:</b> In 2017-2020 I am 50/50 at Princeton University and\n        the Institute for Advanced Study where I am leading a <a href=\"http://www.math.ias.edu/theoretical_machine_learning\">new\n\n\n\n\n\n          program in Theoretical Machine Learning.<br>\n        </a>(Postdoc applications are welcome at both institutions;\n        apply by Dec 1 2017).<br>\n        Dec 1 2019 Deadline: <a href=\"http://www.math.ias.edu/sp/Optimization_Statistics_and_Theoretical_Machine_Learning\">Special\n          year-long machine learning program at IAS. </a><br>\n        <br>\n        July 2018: Link to ICML tutorial: <a href=\"http://unsupervised.cs.princeton.edu/deeplearningtutorial.html\">\"Toward\n\n\n\n          Theoretical Understanding of Deep Learning.\" <br>\n          <br>\n        </a>August 2018: Slides of plenary lecture at International\n        Congress of Mathematicians 2018: <a href=\"https://www.dropbox.com/s/y6iviaa9d30kxpo/icm18talk.pptx?dl=0\">\"The\n\n\n          mathematics of machine learning and deep learning.\"</a> More\n        links <a href=\"http://unsupervised.cs.princeton.edu/ICMtalk/aroraplenary.html\">here.</a><br>\n        <br>\n        <b>Contact info: </b><br>\n        Computer Science Dept,<br>\n        35 Olden St, Princeton NJ 08540<br>\n        609-258-3869 (but <b>don't l</b>eave a msg; send email instead)<br>\n        609-258-4562 (Ms Mitra Kelly; Admin. Assistant)<br>\n        609-258-1771 (Fax)<br>\n        <img src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" alt=\"\"><br>\n        Email address for recommendation letters only:<br>\n        <img src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" alt=\"\"><br>\n        Twitter (but pls don't send me msgs there): <a href=\"https://twitter.com/prfsanjeevarora\"><img src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" alt=\"\" border=\"0\" height=\"22\" width=\"106\"></a><br>\n        <br>\n        While on sabbatical in Spring 2013 I started a <a href=\"http://sanjeevstravels.blogspot.com/\">travelogue that I\n          still maintain. </a><br>\n        <span style=\"color: rgb(0, 0, 128); font-family: 'Times New\n          Roman'; font-size: medium; font-style: normal; font-variant:\n          normal; font-weight: normal; letter-spacing: normal;\n          line-height: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: -webkit-left;\n          text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; white-space: normal;\n          widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-size-adjust: auto;\n          -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; background-color: rgb(255,\n          255, 255); display: inline !important; float: none;\"></span> </div>\n      <div id=\"footer\">\n        <p><span>\u00a9 2012 </span><big>Sanjeev Arora</big><br>\n          Template design by <a href=\"http://andreasviklund.com/\">Andreas\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n            Viklund</a><br>\n        </p>\n      </div>\n    </div>\n  \n\n</body></html>"
